page.title: 19TRANSPORT
page.content: The lack of public transport affects CASTLE CARROCK as it does other rural areas, and especially as many of the inhabitants are elderly. This means they are less capable of using their own transport and have a greater need for services which are not found within the village. There are only 5 buses a day to Carlisle on weekdays (the last one from Carlisle is 17.45, limiting evening entertainment), 2 on Saturdays and one on Sundays. Only 2 buses a day link the nearest town of Brampton, with none at weekends. The original nearest railway station closed many years ago leaving Brampton Junction (4 miles, no bus) as the nearest one. There are 9 trains a weekday between Carlisle and Newcastle, most of which stop at Brampton Junction.
